result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on January 31, 2023 at 03:00 pm.

1:47 PM Defendant Steven M Whitehurst in court.  Attorney Eryn M Menden in court for Steven M Whitehurst. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense requests more time to for Defendant to complete up front community service, and requests a plea/sentencing hearing. Court sets.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 31, 2023 at 03:00 pm.

9:32 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. Defendant Steven M Whitehurst in court.  Attorney Eryn M Menden in court for Steven M Whitehurst. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense is asking for one more status to continue negotiating with the state re: restitution. Court sets.
Hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

File not called on the record.
District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Abigail Kincheloe, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant Steven M Whitehurst in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  

Defense is still having discovery issues.  Hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Eryn M Menden in court.   Defendant Steven M Whitehurst did appear.   Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Menden asks for a new date to get offer. Court sets.  Hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:28 AM Defendant Steven M Whitehurst in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 1, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Austin D./Lori R./Carrabbas Restaurant listed in the Criminal Complaint.

08:54 AM Defendant Steven M Whitehurst in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Attorney Menden is appointed.
Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 09:15 am.
